quotes.quote: Be the calm eye of the storm where nothing phases you, focus on your centre to remain balanced, let your life flow like a stream of wind.
There's calm in each and every day, we just need to practice reaching out for it.
They became nonchalant because this was more or less an everyday occurrence out there.
The ability to remain calm and focused in stressful situations is central to making positive decisions.
To be calm is the highest achievement of the best of what you have.
Be the light in the dark, be the calm in the storm and be at peace while at war.
Remaining calm in times of desperation makes way for opportunity.
Nonchalance is the ability to remain down to earth when everything else is up in the air.
Relax and calm your mind. Forget about yourself and follow your opponent's movement.
There's calm in the mind of the humble. An unmistakable peace of not having to prove anything to anyone.
A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.
Nonchalant putts count the same as chalant putts.
Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along.
Let your soul stand cool and composed before a million universes.
Be calm in arguing; for fierceness makes error a fault, and truth discourtesy.
Nothing is so bitter that a calm mind cannot find comfort in it.
Good acting is about being as natural and calm as possible. These days producers have such definite ideas that you have to be prepared to do whatever they ask.
Be calm like a calm lake, then you will look beautiful like a beautiful calm lake!
A calm mind helps our human intelligence to assess the situation realistically.
Calm self-confidence is as far from conceit as the desire to earn a decent living is remote from greed.
If you are calm about your ambitions, you become confident of achieving what you set out to do.
Be calm in the face of all common disgraces.
Calm sailing doesn't come from calm waters, it comes from having a good navigator; a good crew and a good vessel.
